jsx.ui.dd
Class Draggable

java.lang.Object
  js.Disposable
      jsx.Configurable
          jsx.Source
              jsx.ui.Widget
                  jsx.ui.dd.Draggable
All Implemented Interfaces:
OnDragMove, OnDragStart, OnDragStop
Direct Known Subclasses:
Resizable
public class Draggable
extends Widget
implements OnDragStart, OnDragMove, OnDragStop

A base class for wrapper widgets that can be dragged by mouse handles.

A Draggable widget is a Widget that makes its underlying HTML element movable or Resizable in accordance with a Mouse widget to which it listens mouse events.

A Draggable widget is Configurable and is also an event source which fires Widget.Event events.

Author:
J.J.Liu (Jianjun Liu) at http://www.jscripter.org

Field Detail

DELEGABLE

public static final Id<java.lang.Boolean> DELEGABLE

A global identifier for a configurable property of a Draggable object.

The identified configurable property of a Draggable object refers to a boolean value specifying whether to create a ghost to show dragging of the widget.

Since:
1.0

NOLIMIT

public static final int NOLIMIT

This constant is the default value for the LIMIT configurable property of a Draggable object meaning dragging is free in X and Y dimensions. The constant is also used as an argument in calling the method limit(int).

Since:
1.0
See Also:
Constant Field Values

LIMIT_X

public static final int LIMIT_X

This constant is a legal value for the LIMIT configurable property of a Draggable object meaning only the Y dimension is free for dragging. The constant is also used as an argument in calling the method limit(int).

Since:
1.0
See Also:
Constant Field Values

LIMIT_Y

public static final int LIMIT_Y

This constant is a legal value for the LIMIT configurable property of a Draggable object meaning only the X dimension is free for dragging. The constant is also used as an argument in calling the method limit(int).

Since:
1.0
See Also:
Constant Field Values

LIMIT

protected static final Id<java.lang.Integer> LIMIT

A global identifier for a configurable property of a Draggable object.

The identified configurable property of a Draggable object refers to an integer value specifying whether and how to limit dragging. Possible values are:

  • NOLIMIT: No limitations. Dragging is free in both dimensions.
  • LIMIT_X: Limited in X dimension but free in Y dimension.
  • LIMIT_Y: Limited in Y dimension but free in X dimension.

Since:
1.0

MOUSE

protected static final Id<Mouse> MOUSE

A global identifier for a configurable property of a Draggable object.

The identified configurable property of a Draggable widget refers to the mouse handle of the draggable widget.

Since:
1.0

X

protected static final Id<java.lang.Double> X

A global identifier for a configurable property of a Draggable object.

The identified configurable property of a Draggable object refers to a numerical value caching the X coordinate of the mouse position.

Since:
1.0

Y

protected static final Id<java.lang.Double> Y

A global identifier for a configurable property of a Draggable object.

The identified configurable property of a Draggable object refers to a numerical value caching the Y coordinate of the mouse position.

Since:
1.0

START

protected static final Id<java.lang.Boolean> START

A global identifier for a configurable property of a Draggable object.

The identified configurable property of a Draggable object refers to a boolean value specifying whether the mouse has started to drag.

Since:
1.0

GHOST

protected static final Id<Component> GHOST

A global identifier for a configurable property of a Draggable object.

The identified configurable property of a Draggable object refers to a cached ghost component that is delegated to show dragging process.

Since:
1.0
Constructor Detail

Draggable

protected Draggable(ObjectLike ini)

A typical constructor that constructs a wrapper widget of this type and forces constructors of subclasses to pass initializing data.

This constructor invokes the typical constructor of the superclass passing the specified initializing object as the argument and attaches the draggable widget being created to the configured mouse widget or a new mouse handle obtained from the wrapped component if such a mouse handle is not specified in the passed initializing object.

Parameters:
ini - The initializing object.
Since:
1.0

Draggable

public Draggable(Component e,
                 Mouse h)

Constructs a draggable widget that wraps a specified component and makes it draggable in accordance with the mouse handle specified as an argument to which the newly constructed widget will listen mouse events.

This constructor invokes the typical constructor of this class passing an new initializing object as the argument and setting the configurable property Widget.COMPONENT to the argument component, MOUSE to the argument mouse widget.

Parameters:
e - The component to be wrapped by the wrapper widget being created.
h - The mouse widget to be attached to the draggable widget being created.
Since:
1.0

Draggable

public Draggable(Component e)

Constructs a draggable widget that wraps and drags a specified component.

This constructor simply invokes the constructor Draggable(Component, Mouse) passing the specified component as the first argument and the mouse widget obtained from the same component as the second argument.

Parameters:
e - The component to be wrapped and dragged by the wrapper widget being created.
Since:
1.0
Method Detail

limit

public final void limit(int limit)

Sets a limitation for dragging the draggable widget.

This method simply sets the configurable property LIMIT of the current draggable widget to the argument value.

Parameters:
limit - An integer value indicating whether and how to limit dragging. See LIMIT for possible values.
Since:
1.0
See Also:
LIMIT, NOLIMIT, LIMIT_X, LIMIT_Y

getMouse

public final Mouse getMouse()

Gets the mouse handle currently attached to the draggable widget.

This method simply returns the configurable property MOUSE of the current draggable widget.

Returns:
The mouse widget attached to the draggable.
Since:
1.0

attach

public final void attach(Mouse h)

Attaches a specified mouse handle to the draggable widget.

This method detaches the old mouse handle if there is one and attaches the specified one to the current draggable widget enabling it to drag and the draggable widget to listen mouse events from the mouse handle with a call to the method listen(Mouse). Call this method from event listeners with caution.

Parameters:
h - The new mouse widget to be attached to the draggable.
Since:
1.0
See Also:
detach()

detach

public final void detach()

Detaches the current mouse handle from the draggable widget.

This method removes the mouse handle currently attached to the draggable widget and unregisters it as an event listener from the mouse widget with all event types. Call the method from event listeners with caution.

Since:
1.0
See Also:
attach(Mouse)

listen

protected void listen(Mouse h)

Registers this draggable widget as an event listener to a specified mouse handle with the necessary event types.

A subclass may either override and invoke this method to register with more event types or override but not invoke this method to register with a new set of event types. Call the method from event listeners with caution.

Parameters:
h - A mouse widget.
Since:
1.0
See Also:
unlisten(Mouse)

unlisten

protected void unlisten(Mouse h)

unregisters this draggable widget as an event listener from a specified mouse handle with the necessary event types.

A subclass may either override and invoke this method or override but not invoke this method to unregister with all the registered event types. Call this method from event listeners with caution.

Parameters:
h - A mouse widget.
Since:
1.0
See Also:
listen(Mouse)

onEvent

public void onEvent(DragStart evt)

Performs an action on the dispatched event.

This method calls the method press(Draggable, DragStart) to prepare for dragging and then enters the dragging mode if it is not started.

Specified by:
onEvent in interface OnDragStart
Parameters:
evt - The event dispatched to this listener.
Since:
1.0

delegable

protected static final boolean delegable(Draggable d)

Determines whether a specified draggable widget needs to delegate the dragging process to a ghost component.

Parameters:
d - A draggable widget.
Returns:
true if the configurable property DELEGABLE of the specified draggable widget is true or the underlying component wrapped by the specified draggable widget is fixed. Otherwise, the method returns false.
Since:
1.0

press

protected static final void press(Draggable d,
                                  DragStart evt)

Prepares a draggable widget for dragging with a specified mouse press event.

This method caches the necessary position data of both mouse and underlying component and creates a ghost component if it is delegable according to a call to the method delegable(Draggable). A subclass may also call this method to meet its particular needs.

Parameters:
d - A draggable widget that is being dragged.
evt - The mouse press event that starts the dragging mode.
Since:
1.0

onEvent

public void onEvent(DragMove evt)

Performs an action on the dispatched event.

This method moves the draggable widget or its ghost component with a call to the method move(Component, Position, Integer) accordingly.

Specified by:
onEvent in interface OnDragMove
Parameters:
evt - The event dispatched to this listener.
Since:
1.0

onEvent

public void onEvent(DragStop evt)

Performs an action on the dispatched event.

This method calls the method release(Draggable, Position) to end dragging if it is in a dragging mode.

Specified by:
onEvent in interface OnDragStop
Parameters:
evt - The event dispatched to this listener.
Since:
1.0

release

protected static final void release(Draggable d,
                                    Position<?> evt)

Releases a draggable widget from dragging mode with a specified mouse position event.

This method moves the underlying component of the argument draggable widget with a call to the method move(Component, Position, Integer) and deletes the ghost component if necessary. A subclass may also call this method to meet its particular needs.

Parameters:
d - A draggable widget that is to exit dragging mode.
evt - A mouse position event ending the dragging and providing the position of mouse at that time.
Since:
1.0

move

protected static final void move(Component e,
                                 Position<?> evt,
                                 java.lang.Integer limit)

Moves a specified component with a specified mouse position and a required limitation.

This method moves the specified component by applying a style object created with the cached position data and the return result of a call to the method move(double, double, Integer). It fires an Animation event, with the style object that has just been created, from the specified component. A subclass may also call this method to meet its particular needs.

Parameters:
e - A component need to move.
evt - A mouse position providing the end position.
limit - The limitation of the motion. See LIMIT for possible values.
Since:
1.0

move

protected static final ObjectLike move(double x,
                                       double y,
                                       java.lang.Integer limit)

Creates and returns a style object of position data with the specified coordinates and limitation.

A subclass may also call this method to meet its particular needs.

Parameters:
x - The X coordinate.
y - The Y coordinate.
limit - Limits a coordinate in an axis direction. See LIMIT for possible values.
Returns:
The created style object.
Since:
1.0

abs

protected static final double abs(java.lang.Number x)

Returns the absolute value of an integer.

A subclass may also call this method to meet its particular needs.

Parameters:
x - A number value.
Returns:
The absolute value of the integer. It is never less than 0.
Since:
1.0
